alert.note: Alert for Dawson; Prairie; Wibaux (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 11:44PM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Wibaux, southeastern Prairie and southern Dawson Counties through 1245 AM MDT... At 1143 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles south of West Glendive, or 13 miles south of Glendive, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Glendive, Wibaux, Fallon, West Glendive, Carlyle, Hoyt, Hodges, Mildred, Forest Park, Marsh, Saint Phillip and Yates. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
